intro: Centaurea pratensis proles debeauxii, commonly known as the Debeaux's field centaury, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its height ranges from 30 to 60 centimeters, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The showy blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
